reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.review: I really wanted to love these. I like the simple design and they seem to absorb plenty but there’s no elastic at the back and we had a blow out with every single poop. It would go straight up the back and into his clothes. Too bad

reviews.name: Kevin C Lynch
reviews.title: Super Soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.review: We really wanted to love these diapers. They are super soft and are very absorbent with pee! Never had any leakage. The only downside is that every poop was a blowout. The back isn't high enough and there is no elastic in the back to prevent blowouts.

reviews.name: Kevin C Lynch
reviews.title: Super Soft
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.review: We really wanted to love these diapers. They are super soft and are very absorbent with pee! Never had any leakage. The only downside is that every poop was a blowout. The back isn't high enough and there is no elastic in the back to prevent blowouts.

reviews.name: Lauren
reviews.title: Leak terrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2025
reviews.review: The feel is comparable to Huggies skin essentials. However these are hands down the worst diapers we’ve ever tried! The description says can be used as over nights but even during the day time we are changing our daughter more than we would with any other diaper because they leak so bad. We are just trying to use them up to get rid of them. We’ve never had a leaking problem with diapers so this has been frustrating. If wetness indicators are important to you there isn’t one. It doesn’t bother me because we typically don’t go more than 2-3 hours without changing her anyways because who wants to sit in a wet diaper?

reviews.name: danika
reviews.title: Sides break easily
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2025
reviews.review: We have used this brand for a while the side straps aren't the strongest we haven't had a ton of issues. Until this last box we got. At least every other diaper the side straps break off. Including tonight after I stood my 1 year old daughter up and she had it on all but 2 min before one side broke in half. We are not over pulling or putting them on to tight, causing them to stretch out. They simply just tear. Super frustrating and unfortunately probably going to switch brands now. Which is sad because I like the rest of the aspects of the product.

reviews.name: Ash
reviews.title: TERRIBLE , AWKWARD design, too short and small , gave baby terrible rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2025
reviews.review: Diapers are very expensive and terrible quality, the diapers are very small/short and very tight , my son who wears a size 6 in every brand has never had this problem! He never has had a diaper rash before and two night wearing these now has a terrible rash on his hips and red bumps on butt, they must not have anything to allow breathing. They are terrible the pee does not seem to absorb well. Fir organic frangrance free these were very awkward poor quality now I have 100 diapers wasted!! Because they are design very poorly

reviews.name: Jessica Boewer
reviews.title: Diaper brand great! Seller dishonest.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2025
reviews.review: I love these diapers, this seller is who I gave the one star to. Sell wrote “looks and functions as if it were new. Item will come in original packaging” while it was the original box, a pack of diapers was open and 5 are missing. I need these diapers so I can’t return them.

reviews.name: Liking85
reviews.title: Terrible sizing for newborns . Pants are significantly better for toddlers.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2024
reviews.review: I have a toddler that I recently got the pants for. Amazing product. Soft, fits well, easy on and off. I also recently had twins. One was 5lb, the other 6lb. The size 1 diaper is terrible. There’s no way it fits size 4-11lb, my 6 pounder is swimming in it. It also leaks like crazy. Sorry, but you need to redesign the fit as these are just terrible. Looking forward to my smaller hitting 6lb, as I’ll immediately be buying coterie again. For now it’s pampers an Huggies preemie, but I question the composition of those diapers.

reviews.name: N. Barnes
reviews.title: I wanted to like these but can’t…
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2024
reviews.review:
We gave these a try, as I was hoping to switch to a TCF brand that was less expensive than the brand we were currently using. I bought one pack to try during the day, as some reviews complained about leaks.

Pro: The only positive I have to say about them is they are SUPER soft! They felt amazing on the outside.

Cons: Sadly, once you open the diaper you realize there’s only three *strips* of cotton down the middle. They do puff up once pee has been absorbed, but so much space is waisted. I felt like I was buying half a diaper.

Next, performance: I had to change them way more than my go-to diaper (Dyper). But worst of all, my LO started to fight me about diaper changes and refused to want to wear these diapers. A few days after our trial-run started with these diapers, a rash formed and she was visibly super sore. The rash wouldn’t go away until I quit using these diapers.

I was hoping to like these, but we will not be switching from our tried-and-true brand.

reviews.name: Lisa D.
reviews.title: Absolute Garbage- Do not buy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers are trash. Every single time my baby poops it gets everywhere. Constant blowouts and they do not hold poop in for crap, pun intended. I'm just glad I bought a small pack to try out instead of a large one. Thought I'd try to save some money since these were cheaper than other brands that are non toxic, but nope! Will not be purchasing again.

reviews.name: ml783
reviews.title: All the blowouts!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2025
reviews.review: Definitely not blowout proof. I love that they're tcf, but the back isn't stretchy and allllllll the poop escapes and goes everywhere. Glad it was just a small pack to try it out. We will keep looking.

reviews.name: Sofia Carolina
reviews.title: Don’t buy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2025
reviews.review:
Bad diapers.
Super thin, they get full really fast and they can’t have pee when they go #2 bc it comes out.

reviews.name: MM1986
reviews.title: Blowouts Galore
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2024
reviews.review: These caused my newborn baby to blowout his diaper almost every time he wore these and that didn’t happen with other brands. I kept wanting them to workout because they seemed soft and then he’d blow out the diaper. Also, he weighed 6 pounds at birth and stayed at 6 to 7 pounds during most of the time we used these. They were HUGE on him. Absolutely laughable that they say they’d ever fit a 4 pound baby. I guess I’ll stick with Pampers although still looking for a more natural option for my baby.

reviews.name: Jon
reviews.title: Gapping- No elastic, sizing small
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2024
reviews.review: My son is only 8 lbs and already the 7-13lb size 2 don’t fit. There is also no stretch so the diaper shows a huge gap in the front everytime he bends his legs. I have little faith these will protect from a blowout.

reviews.name: Chris
reviews.title: Only adding a star because we love the diapers....
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2024
reviews.review: Let me start out by saying we LOVE Pura Diapers. I ordered size 7 diapers for my daughter through Amazon Resale seller, they weren't coming from Pura on here I guess. They sent me a size 2. So now, at 8pm, I have no diapers for my daughter, and all others sold in stores give her a horrible rash.

reviews.name: Chase
reviews.title: Worse diapers
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2024
reviews.review: I would never purchase this diaper again. I’ve been using HONEST from birth until a few days ago. Honest got so expensive,I had to try another diaper. I read the reviews on this and thought it would be good. But it’s not,you can actually see the poop through it,I’ve seen some washes on my baby,they leak. They’re so thin,no elastic at the back. I’m all the way in Jamaica and now I’m gonna have to search for another brand,I have to pay so much money to get it shipped. Sighs!!

reviews.name: Halie
reviews.title: Greenwashed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024
reviews.review: The inside layer, which is really the only layer that matters, is not 100% cotton. It’s a “plant based” which when you look up the materials, is man-made & is mixed with plastic materials that contain phthalates

reviews.name: Timmy Mcallister
reviews.title: We order monthly and get the wrong size every time
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2024
reviews.review: We love this diaper. However, there’s not many places you can buy pura and every time we buy from amazon, they send the wrong size!! So frustrated.

reviews.name: Logan Visser
reviews.title: Sent the wrong size twice
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2024
reviews.review:
Have sent the wrong size twice now and I am frustrated that I need to go out of my way to return them AGAIN.

Love the diapers, but will be buying them from Walmart from now on - they send the right size

reviews.name: V
reviews.title: Not absorbent.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2024
reviews.review: Very disappointed. Believe the negative reviews. Yes its a soft TCF diaper but not absorbent at all! The diaper gets so soppy that it tears and the filling falls out. Not suitable for overnight or during the day as it's soaked and leaking within 2 hours. Elastic is almost non existent. Glad I only ordered a small pack but still don't want to use them. On to the next brand.

reviews.name: Rachael Hu
reviews.title: KEEPS TEARING AND LEAVING STUFF ON BABY'S BUM
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2024
reviews.review: This diaper is really soft and I love it, in theory. However, after trying 5 boxes, we can safely say that it's caused the most blow outs and leaking issues out of any brand we've tried. Additionally, the diapers kept tearing on our baby's bum, leaving residue of white stuff from the material innards all over her private parts. It's just extremely off putting and it's just not for us. We've reached out to customer service, and they were really great though. They sent a replacement box to us, and assured us that it's an uncommon occurrence, but the replacements still kept ripping and leaking. Super disappointing that it didn't work for us! I had really high hopes.

reviews.name: Precious Piovanetti
reviews.title: Prime day sale fail
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2024
reviews.review: Bought these and another brand during prime day sales and they were not worth the prime day price at all. There’s no indicator line and they don’t have much absorbency. You can also smell the pee through the diaper, which I’m not sure is on purpose since there’s no indicator line? They’re soft and eco friendly but not worth it based on the flaws.

reviews.name: Sharon
reviews.title: FRUSTRATED WITH AMAZON
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2024
reviews.review: I LOVE Pura diapers and wipes. I love the affordability and that they’re good quality. BUT the fact that Amazon has now sent me TWO ORDERS OF THE WRONG SIZE diapers is so frustrating!!!! Now I have NO diapers for my son because they continue to send me whatever size diaper they want!!!! Cancelling my Amazon subscription and going to walmart instead. Thanks amazon!!!!

reviews.name: Sage Furey
reviews.title: It’s a super wrong size!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2024
reviews.review:
I luv the diapers but was sent the wrong size, on the order it clearly says I wanted a size 2.
So it wasn’t my accident or something, I found this out at 6 am with no extra diapers! So that’s fun, hope this doesn’t happen again. Id really like a refund, but they want to the product back.
I need the right size diaper….

reviews.name: Madison Cook
reviews.title: Excellent diapers but terrible buying experience... lol
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2024
reviews.review: So I LOVED these diapers for my baby. They're absorbent, pretty neutral/subtle just white with the orange floral, and the ingredients are much cleaner than most brands. But after buying a small pack to try out, I tried to go back and order a full size box TWO different times and each time I was sent the wrong size. It was a major hassle with customer service to try and get this figured out as I was going to do a subscribe and save for these diapers. It ultimately was a huge headache so I have since switched to a brand I buy in store to avoid being sent the wrong size yet again.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Doesn’t worth a penny !
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2025
reviews.review: Wouldn’t recommend it every poop has leaked out so far so disappointing!!!

reviews.name: Emilia
reviews.title: Caused a rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2025
reviews.review: dont recommend them! gave my baby a rash on day 1.

reviews.name: Julia
reviews.title: Terrible customer service/wrong sizes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2024
reviews.review: The diaper itself is great, no issues there. But I’ve been ordering these for the last 8 months and I’m not even kidding every other month they send me the wrong size. I either return them or use the size if it’s close enough but this last time they gave me the hardest time about returning this item and getting a refund because the next shipment wasn’t for weeks… will not be buying anymore.

reviews.name: Elle
reviews.title: NOT GOOD FOR OVERNIGHT
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2024
reviews.review: I used the size 1 diapers and loved them, so I purchased the size 2. They are terrible! The cotton falls apart when trying to take the diaper off, and they definitely do not last through overnights. We have had so many midnight clothing changes for my baby that I will probably never dry Pura diapers again, which is unfortunate because I really liked the previous pack that I had.

reviews.name: Kelsey
reviews.title: Keep receiving wrong size.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2024
reviews.review: I’ve order size 2 diapers three times now and every time they send size 6. Love these diapers, but I’d probably order from Walmart instead of Amazon. I needed these for a trip and now I’m out of time and going to have to find another brand that works for us (we’re in between sizes for most brands and these are the only ones that seem to fit well with no leaks). Super inconvenient.

reviews.name: Jes
reviews.title: Bad rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2024
reviews.review: My baby is 15 months old and has never had diaper rash before. We’ve been using the same diapers since he was born but decided to try these out and after just a few hours he got a super sore diaper rash.

reviews.name: Alex Forshee
reviews.title: Diaper Rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.review: When my little girl was born we started to use Pampers swaddle. It worked well but it was smelling little chemical. Then I saw this brand. I thought it will be better because it says most of chemical free, cotton, no diaper rash... I used Pampers and Pura both to finish Pampers. I didn't see nothing different. After finished Pampers just I used Pura. And after 1-2 day I saw diaper rash on my little girls skin. I am using cream to heal them but nothing worked her skin has redness because of this diaper. It smells chemical still. Also I subscribed it. When the next delivery time came price increased almost 15$ suddenly. I canceled my subscription and also I won't use Pura anymore. It didn't work for me and was a bad experience. I don't suggest.

reviews.name: Benny Dills
reviews.title: Bad rash!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.review: So first getting this product I was excited to find a more affordable organic ingredient diaper! Both my kids have been on huggies until I found out recently how bad they are. Well I just started using these and noticed a little rash starting on his hips where the flaps are and then today his whole lower back and upper butt area broke out in hives. I don't know understand what he would be allergic to considering these are sensitive and organic diapers but I can say for how bad huggies are allegedly, they never caused my kids to break out in hives. Very disappointed mama right now. However I will say the softness of these diapers are great tho but could use more elastic as the diaper isn't that tight on the back.

reviews.name: Random user
reviews.title: Leak and are full with the smallest pee
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2024
reviews.review: I didn’t realize why my baby was waking up so much throughout the night until switching to another diaper brand. I had to change her 6+ times at night with these diapers and now that I’ve switched only 2-3 time a night.

reviews.name: Jeanerz
reviews.title: Not happy unfortunately
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2024
reviews.review: My son doesn’t usually have sensitive skin towards diapers, we’ve used every brand and the only other one his skin didn’t like was parents choice. We bought Pura and were so excited to use them. I noticed after about 3 days of my son wearing these that he was getting tiny red bumps on his butt cheeks exactly where the diapers sit. I kept an eye on them. They’ve only gotten worse and some have turned into what looks like little zits. Will be switching brands unfortunately. I will say that I love the softness, the packaging and they didn’t leak at all over night.

reviews.name: Manjunatha Devegowda
reviews.title: Poor absorption, frequent blowouts
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2025
reviews.review: Poor absorption

reviews.name: Kaylee
reviews.title: Blowouts galore
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2024
reviews.review: Holy cow. I’ve never seen so many blowouts. Have you ever cleaned poop out of a baby’s bellybutton? Because I have. Have you ever had your baby just chilling in you lap only to have your hand suddenly become wet? Well that’s what’s in store for you if you buy these. Poop up the back. Poop up the front. Poop on the car seat. Poop on your hands. Do yourself a favor and buy literally anything else.

reviews.name: ErinF
reviews.title: Terrible quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2025
reviews.review: The diaper is way too thin and leaks constantly.

reviews.name: M.
reviews.title: Gel constantly leaking all over my baby
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2024
reviews.review: I’ve been using these for the past few months and most of the time when I would change my baby I’d notice little gel clumps all over him. I thought this was odd but stupidly figured it’s a diaper thing till we switched to another diaper and there was no gel all over his skin. I’m guessing that’s where all the diaper rashes from the negative reviews are coming from. Super upset about this.

reviews.name: Tawni Horito
reviews.title: I was sent the wrong size
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2024
reviews.review: Was wondering why they weren’t fitting my child properly and why they seem so small I button from this brand before I was a size 3 not a size 4

reviews.title: Never again
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2024
reviews.review: Got these for my daughter they gave her the WORST rash I’ve seen as a mom in ten years. Not happy with these what so ever would never ever buy would never recommend to anyone

reviews.name: Kelly
reviews.title: Not blowout worthy
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2024
reviews.review: My daughter constantly had blow outs up her back with these diapers. They need a blowout barrier!!

reviews.name: Heather Zayas
reviews.title: Diapers Don’t Stay On
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2024
reviews.review: I really wanted to love these. When I opened the package the size was great and the diapers are so soft. However, my 18 month old has been wearing them for 20 mins and the sides are already ripping. The tabs are weak and the diaper is not very durable. I even made sure the diaper wasn’t on too tight, but no luck.

reviews.name: Ric and Karlee
reviews.title: These are worse than loves or parents choice and cost a ton more
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2023
reviews.review: Let me start with, I love sustainability and I love clean made diapers. I try my best to choose diapers that have the least amount of chemicals possible. But sometimes the diapers are just crap. These run super small. My kid wore two and both times they leaked and poop was coming out of them. It’s like they don’t suck up anything. They caused a rash. The weird pad design inside of them is the cause of not being able to soak anything up. Just overall a horrible diaper. But they think they can charge fancy diaper prices. No thank you. Good luck to those who actually like this diaper

reviews.name: An American Customer
reviews.title: Repeatedly shipped the wrong size
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2024
reviews.review: Buyer beware! I’ve received the wrong size SIX times now. We like these diapers but will not be ordering them from Amazon/this seller ever again.

reviews.name: WS
reviews.title: Do not buy!!!!! Blowouts Galore
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2024
reviews.review: Bought these diapers in a pinch as our normal Coterie were delayed in shipping. The diapers are ill fitting and slide down low in the back and consequently don’t catch anything. They are really, really bad. We’ve had a blowout or leakage out of the leg holes every single time she’s in one of these diapers which is very rare for us. Would definitely not recommend and would caution other parents not to buy unless you want to do even more laundry than you already have to do. 🙃

reviews.name: Amanda Fales
reviews.title: Awful waist of money.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2024
reviews.review: They are extremely cheaply made, very thin, and blow out the majority of the time. By far the worse diapers we have used.

reviews.name: Mitchro
reviews.title: Rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2024
reviews.review: Caused a very large rash after wearing a few diapers and our child is not sensitive to diapers normally. Rash was very red and I’ve seen a bunch of other reviews saying the same thing, so I would not reccomend these diapers. Good thing we bought the small pack to try them first.

reviews.name: JC
reviews.title: Good on paper but that’s all
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.review: My middle child is allergic to ingredients used for “breathable films” or “breathable sheets” in most diaper brands. She’s potty trained now but we’ve tried dozens of diapers over the last couple years. I’ve been experimenting with various diapers with my 6 month old. Pura is hands down one of the worst diapers I’ve ever tried. No indicator line, the tabs don’t stay in place, the diaper shifts around, and CONSTANT blowouts. I still have most of the package too because the few I tried were that bad.

reviews.name: Jessica
reviews.title: Leaks and does not hold blowouts
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2024
reviews.review: I’m surprised these had good reviews becasue I am not impressed. Everything leaks through! I’ve had to change my baby out of clothes and change crib sheets with these. I’m glad they were cheap but I’m so disappointed I really wanted to like these due to the natural ingredients

reviews.name: Adriene
reviews.title: This is the 4th time
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2024
reviews.review: Pura diapers order keeps sending out incorrectly so now we are out of diapers for the 4th time!! We love these diapers they work great for our daughter but who ever keeps shipping these can’t tell the difference between size 3, 6 or 7. Thanks again for failing.

reviews.name: Gerard Tan
reviews.title: Multiple Leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2024
reviews.review: Had 2 blow outs and at least 4 leaks! The worst experience so far

reviews.name: Bareen
reviews.title: Leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2024
reviews.review: Tho i really wanted this to work cuz its so gentle on skin but it leaks everytime i used i change my baby’s diaper every 2 hour however this leaks before i had to finish the box but had to change cloths everytime

reviews.name: Eloy Gonzalez
reviews.title: Feel cheap
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2024
reviews.review: I wanted to like these but they are very thin. They resemble very thin period pads. They also don’t have an indicator line and if you have a newborn you’ll need that to track wet diapers in the beginning. I change my babies very frequently and these still leak out and I’ve noticed that the diaper starts to fall apart? It leaves traces of cotton or whatever material they use on my babies skin.

reviews.name: Maria Johnson
reviews.title: Leak really bad
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2024
reviews.review: These diapers leak so badly, I have to have the same amount of extra pants for my child as I do diapers. The only way to ensure they won't leak is to change them every half hour, as it is, I do change them pretty frequently. And if the leaking wasn't bad enough, they've just straight up fallen apart and the silica gel balls got all over my toddler a few times.

reviews.name: Trisha
reviews.title: Heartbroken
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2024
reviews.review: When I read the description i thought i finally found the best diaper for my baby. Organic cotton, award winning , UK brand!! With highest hopes i started using it on her. I was shocked. This is the only diaper that gave her rashes . And I have so far tried 10+ brands. Terrible absorbency. I was really heartbroken. Tried it again after few days.. again bad rashes!!! Looks like chemicals are not always bad! Switching back to Pampers Pure!

reviews.name: Boogie
reviews.title: Good Diapers Bad Service
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2024
reviews.review: Great diapers but failed to get me the diapers I ordered twice. Trying another brand to see if I can get what I need.

reviews.name: Ashlie
reviews.title: Not absorbent at all
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.review: I got these to try as I’m testing out different non toxic diapers. The first one my son had in for less than 2 hours. When I picked him up out of his car seat he was soaked and his seat was soaked. When I changed him, the diaper wasn’t even wet. It contained his poop and that’s about it. I thought I had accidentally put him in a swim diaper. Do not recommend these at all unfortunately.

reviews.name: Tenz
reviews.title: Had such high expectations
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2024
reviews.review:
I was really disappointed. I was extremely excited to use this and was hoping it will be leak proof for my baby. But I was wrong. My baby’s clothes were wet after using Pura for 2 hours. I am glad I only got one pack. Will not be buying it again.
It is definitely soft though. I think that is the only good thing I can say about the diaper.

reviews.name: ashley
reviews.title: Chemical burn
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2024
reviews.review: I wanted a eco price tag cotton diaper for my neurodivergent son with sensitive skin. The gave him a chemical burn. I tried once and the burn appeared. 2 weeks later I tried again to verify these were the cause and it happened again. I do not recommend at all.

reviews.name: Madi Lockhart
reviews.title: RASHES
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.review: I was excited to try this product for my little based on the organic cotton and TCF claims, but oh my gosh, these gave my little pretty instant rashes and irritation. I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt and tried changing them more often then I would the other brand I was using prior (Dyper) but even so, they were awful. Do not recommend. Went back to Dyper and ZERO issues.

reviews.name: nicole
reviews.title: Terrible diapers.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.review: Not very absorbent at all. Doesn’t fit as well as other size 4 diapers we’ve tried. Runs a bit smaller if day. Literally had a blowout on the very first diaper we tried and it seems to be full in just a few minutes. They are really soft to the touch but just also feel kind of cheap. I wouldn’t recommend to anyone. Hate these.

reviews.name: Joshua Chopp
reviews.title: Trash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2024
reviews.review: Don’t waste your money on these. I was so excited to try a chlorine free diaper and I have been sorely disappointed. Unfortunately, they leak pee out of the leg holes after only a few hours and when the diaper is not even very full. Very disappointing.

reviews.name: Hamid Ali Abbasi
reviews.title: Dissatisfied
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2024
reviews.review: At first sight I was happy as they looked super soft and comfortable. But after using them for a few days. They are a disaster. My 2yrs old was all wet and his clothes all dirty only because they can’t hold it for longer and are not anti leaks.

reviews.name: Ilka
reviews.title: Poor shipping and attempted cover up!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2024

reviews.name: EB
reviews.title: Don’t bother. 3+ overflows at night.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.review: Save your money. I ordered size 7 for my 40lb, tall, slim kiddo for overnight diapers (he usually dry, but I wanted a back-up) these fit like a size 5/6, and they have not been absorbent enough on 3 nights now.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Blowouts
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.review: We have used many different diapers.. honest, hello Bello, Millie moon, and have never had a blowout or even a leak. Since using these diapers we have had multiple blowouts and ruined several outfits. Really disappointed for the price.

reviews.name: Genevieve
reviews.title: Pura Diaper
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2024
reviews.review: Diaper is soft but leaks.

reviews.name: Emily
reviews.title: Rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.review: If your child has sensitive skin I wouldn’t recommend. I thought it was a good deal for the diapers and that they are organic but I used 3 and my son broke out in a HORRIBLE diaper rash from these.

reviews.name: thanatos90
reviews.title: So thin!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2024
reviews.review: I hated these. They technically worked and we were able to use them up but I was so happy when we finished the box. Just really thin, didn't feel as secure as other diapers.

reviews.name: Janna B
reviews.title: They leak every time
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2024
reviews.review: Bought these because my daughter has sensitive skin and they are pathetic. Would not recommend.

reviews.name: Maria Smirnova

reviews.review: They leak every time and sizing they labeled is way off, I have to buy new diapers now and toss the entire box. Never again

reviews.name: Christian Ham

reviews.review: My granddaughter broke out with a scalding red rash from these diapers.

reviews.name: Mike

reviews.review: The size 6 was like a size 4.

reviews.name: Jane

reviews.name: Jonathan Eugenio

reviews.review: It’s not a good diaper. Yes it’s clean ingredients but it’s not poop friendly and everything just comes out. Might as well not wear a diaper for baby lol.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer

reviews.review: It’s soft but because its design, no way to make tight enough to not leak.

reviews.name: Amazon customer
reviews.title: Rash

reviews.review: I wanted to like these but my baby got a rash while using them. He has never had this before so I have to assume it was the diapers.

reviews.name: Bhianca Santos

reviews.review: Flimsy, too small to size, dosent hold pee well, and one of the flaps ripped off when trying to secure diaper

reviews.name: Anonymous4
reviews.title: Wrong size sent and leaks
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.review: I ordered size 5 and size 3 was sent. Returned them. Then reordered size 5, got it and first two diapers leaked. So frustrating.

reviews.name: Cameron
reviews.title: Very poor quality
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.review: These are by far the worst diapers I have ever bought. They look and feel nice but they keep getting all bunched up and come apart. Never Again.

reviews.name: Shellary Barber
reviews.title: Rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.review: I did not like these they gave my grandson a rash after 2 days of wearing this brand. Was not impressed.

reviews.name: Narek Ohanyan

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2024
reviews.review: Wanted to bad to like these as a TCF alternative since either more affordable brands have switched to ECF like Honest or been discontinued like Seventh Generation but it's a pass. So full of pee and wet quickly. That was diaper 1. I don't dare use them out in public or overnight. Glad we only have the one small pack to try. Will not repurchase. Guess we're back to the drawing board. In the meantime hopefully Costco can fill the void Huggies Special Delivery left. Liked them with my first but really sad it's so much harder to get a TCF option that doesn't cost an arm and a leg so settle for something absorbant at least.

Also noticed few nights where there were leakages from her pee. Love how soft they are and fit nicely but too many problems.

reviews.name: ryan reynolds
reviews.title: No way these are for a newborn
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2024
reviews.review: These run HUGE, not big…HUGE. My daughter is 10 pounds now and still half the weight she’d need to be to fit these. Leaks, blowouts, etc… I’m honestly so shocked how anybody’s newborn would come close to fitting in these. And all the positive reviews??? What’s the catch??

reviews.name: Cecelia
reviews.title: Love these diapers - but no wetness indicator size 3 & up??
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.review: We’ve been using these diapers since he was a newborn for my son, and really liked them a lot! We use Coterie at night because they’re more absorbent, but have been using Pur during the day since they’re chlorine free, and as natural as you can get - yes, they’re very soft and all the other good things. But to say I’m super annoyed when sizing up to a 3 is an understatement. WHY there’s suddenly no wetness indicator is beyond me? Why if my baby is a size 3 do I not need that all of a sudden?? I guess I have to look for another brand now, and return these. Really frustrating.

reviews.name: Diana
reviews.title: Huge for a size one
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.review: My husband bought them without speaking with me first. These diapers are HUGE! My newborn look ridiculous in these. It wraps around her waist and still fits huge. Sizing makes no sense. It’s tiny at the front and the wings are for a huge baby. Material is nice but that’s the only good thing.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2024
reviews.review: Not in no kinda plastic wrap or a box they've been tossed round & the pkg was ripped open when it got here & there's dirt all in the bag .

products.product_name: Pura Hypoallergenic Diaper Pants Size 5 (27-38 lbs) Overnight, up to 12 Hours Leak Protection, Suitable for Sensitive Skin, Totally Chlorine Free, Soft Organic Cotton, 3 packs of 19 (57 Pull Up Pants)

reviews.name: Review My Life, by Katie Lara
reviews.title: Best pull ups!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2025
reviews.review: Love these pull ups! They fit great - are soft and stretchy. Their designed and quality are good because I have two kiddos wearing these and have not experienced a leak even overnight. I really love that they are free from chlorine and other harmful chemicals. My kids both have eczema and extremely sensitive skin and these have never caused irritation.

reviews.name: Destiny M.
reviews.title: I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER BRAND OF DIAPERS!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2025
reviews.review:
I will NEVER buy another brand of diapers after trying these out!! I’m what they call a “crunchy” mom and if a baby is wearing a diaper 24/7, I truly believe that they should be in the best quality diaper. They hold an insane amount of urine (has kept my baby sleeping peacefully since he was THREE months old), quality of materials are amazing, thickness is what you would expect.

They are also, in my opinion, softer than Coterie (the Cadillac brand of diapers), AND they’re cheaper than Coterie. My baby has NEVER had a rash while using these, and they’re TOTALLY chlorine free, and not just elemental chlorine free which I think is a dealbreaker. I just wish they sold these in stores!!

reviews.name: Lorry king
reviews.title: Love love love!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2024
reviews.review: Been using Pura diapers for my son since he was born. As we’re getting ready to transition into potty training these diaper pants are top tier! They are snug enough to not let any leaks out and not too tight to cause discomfort. The absorbency is just as good as the regular diapers so nothing is leaking out. My son has never had a diaper rash while using Pura. I love that they are so soft, have no fragrance, and are just as good - if not BETTER than major name brands. I’m very thankful to have found Pura diapers!

reviews.name: A.H.
reviews.title: Soft durable
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2024
reviews.review: These are so soft, stretchable and hold up throughout the night! Finally a good overnight pull-up for my potty trained toddlers. Fit great not too tight.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2025

reviews.name: O. S.
reviews.title: My 5 year old likes to put these on himself before bed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2024
reviews.review: Since my son only wears diapers at night now (he's 5) I decided to try pull ups so he can put them on himself and get used to the feeling of underwear (which he still refuses to wear). He loves putting these on himself, I think it was starting to get embarrassing for him to have his parents put a diaper on him each night, still. So these make him feel more independent, they are very protective and don't fall off like diapers tend to do during the night since the little straps can come off and cause a bed wetting accident. I think these are better than diapers in that way and they are also very soft, stretchy, and don't make that awful papery, crunchy sound that regular diapers do. I love that these ones are also fragrance free, bleach free, carbon neutral, made from plant based materials and in recyclable paper packaging.

reviews.name: Fit perfect.
reviews.title: Great fit
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2025

reviews.name: Haley
reviews.title: SO SOFT
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2024
reviews.review: These pull ups are SO soft! We got a size 5 for our 27 pound 1 year old, and they fit him very well. I really liked using them, but because they are pull ups and don’t have Velcro sides, I think they would be better for kids that aren’t as squirmy or ones that understand how to step into pants. He understands how to step out, but stepping in was sometimes a struggle. Otherwise, I thought they held up well and he didn’t pull on the waistband like he does with diapers. Overall, I think these are a really great option for parents that are looking for a TCF pull up option.

They haven't even leaked!! We have tried other brands before but we still had leaking problems so I'm happily surprised. These are now officially my go to disposables

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2025
reviews.review: These diapers are soft and I like how comfy the waistband is, however they have trouble actually holding the liquid. These diapers feel wetter than other brands and don't seem to hold as much liquid. We thought about using them for overnight but they always leaked.

reviews.name: Lorry king

reviews.review: These wipes were bigger than I expected! They do seem on the thinner side, but they get the job done and a bonus they’re flushable! My toddler is potty training and these work great as well as don’t cause him any irritation or rashes. I’d say for skin protection 10/10 and durability 8/10. reviews.name: Smoore
reviews.title: Good clean wipe
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2024
reviews.review: I like that these are very natural and feel nice. They are just the right thickness and size. I am an adult and use these for when toilet paper just doesn't cut it. These are definitely gentler than toilet paper. They are a little pricey but then again everything that's good for the planet seems to cost more. I don't use a lot so it's a good value for me, but if you go through a lot I would imagine it could start to add up. I feel better buying something like this knowing that it's natural and non-toxic for my body and the environment. And that it will break down because it's not made of plastic (rven though the packaging is, oh well)

reviews.name: BVS Family
reviews.title: Favorite nontoxic wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2024
reviews.review: We love Pura wipes! They’re the most affordable nontoxic. EWG verified baby wipes on the market. Tip: I remove the plastic snap lids from other wet wipes packaging (such as Parents Choice or Honest) and stick them on my Pura wipes so I don’t have to deal with the tape that comes on the Pura packaging. It makes accessing wipes much faster and easier. Note that this only works if you use the wipes quickly; if left for months, the wipes will dry out over time.

reviews.review: These wipes are definitely a top-notch choice for parents looking for a gentle and eco-friendly option. The fact that they are 100% plastic-free and plant-based makes them an excellent choice for the environment. Plus, with 99% water content, they are incredibly gentle on sensitive and eczema-prone skin. The fragrance-free and hypoallergenic formula ensures that your baby's delicate skin won't be irritated. Additionally, the wipes are cruelty-free, which is always a big bonus in my book. And with the EWG verification, you can rest assured that these wipes meet high safety standards. Overall, the Pura Baby Wipes are a smart and thoughtful choice for both your baby and the planet!

reviews.title: Great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.review:
As with most brands, I wish each cloth was more moist.

I price checked each baby wipe brand that was listed as EWG verified and PURA is the only brand with a reasonable price. I purchased one 60ct pack at $2.89 (compared to 56ct Pampers Pure at $2.67, EWG rated 1)

The cloths are soft, but the low moisture content also caused the wipes to want to stick together as they're pulled out of the pack.

I appreciate the thoughtful towards health and environmental impact. 4 of 5 only because they're be more practical with more moisture. Thank you Pura! I'm off to purchase the bundle!

reviews.name: Blake
reviews.title: Good for the skin, but not the best option for us
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2024
reviews.review:
I recently tried Pura Baby Wipes for my 19-month-old son, and while they had some positive aspects, they ultimately fell short of my expectations. One of the standout features was their soothing effect on my son's diaper rash. The wipes seemed gentle and left his skin feeling soft, which was a relief during those uncomfortable moments.

However, there were a couple of downsides that made me hesitant to purchase them again. First, I found the durability of the wipes lacking compared to other brands. They would often tear easily, especially during more thorough cleanups, which was frustrating. Additionally, these wipes are a bit pricey for our budget. While I appreciate their soothing ingredients, the cost isn't justifiable when considering the overall performance and durability.

In conclusion, although Pura Baby Wipes did a good job with diaper rash care, the combination of their lack of durability and higher price point means we won't be repurchasing them. There are more affordable and durable options available that better suit our needs while still giving our son the comfort he needs.

reviews.name: Anna Petrucci
reviews.title: Wanted to love these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2024
reviews.review: I did a ton of research on baby wipes after discovering that most brands contain PFAS and was very excited to find that Pura seemed to have some of the cleanest and environmentally friendly wipes. Although the wipes are fine for an every day diaper change or for cleaning baby's hands/face, they're not great for poop diapers. The wipes themselves feel somewhat dry, they stick together in the package and are hard to unstick with one hand, and are very thin, forcing you to use double what you would normally use. I love what the brand stands for, but execution needs work.

They’re also very stuck together and don’t come out of the packaging easily. The other thing is that you have to be very careful when you first open a new package bc it can rip open so easily. It’s a good price point for non toxic wipes, but bc they’re so thin, you go through them faster.

reviews.name: JanB
reviews.title: Not Lovin' This Package Design
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2025
reviews.review: Well....I suppose the wipes are ok, but trying to get one out of the package is difficult. I would try to find an "end" to pull, and then it tears off in my hand. So I find an "end" again and pull, and 5 or 6 wipes want to come out at the same time. Uggg. Plus, there is only a piece of tape to re-seal the package, and it loses it's adhesive quickly. Plus, when several wipes tried to come out at once, it ripped the opening. So then I had to place some of my own tape over it so that the rest of the wipes didn't dry out. However, before I could use the entire package, many wipes DID dry out entirely. I'd say that if this company changed the design of their package, it would make the product MUCH more user-friendly.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Smell!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2025
reviews.review: Seemed to work average but I couldn’t get over the smell. It was so strong and was distinct I couldn’t stand it. Won’t be purchasing again for that reason

reviews.name: LumpySpaceMama
reviews.title: Too thin
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2024
reviews.review: Probably works best for younger babies. My son is 7 months and eating solids and let me tell you, these are by far the thinnest wipes I have ever used. These wipes domt work well for us. I was originally impressed by the ingredients but that's about where the pros stop. These smelled oddly like yogurt? Like plain yogurt which added a sickening tartness to my baby's skin. There is also no texture so I feel like I have to use more wipes to actually get my baby clean. I went through these really fast so I don't think they are a good value at all. I will not purchase these again. Their diapers are however, phenomenal and comparable to Parasol if you are interested.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Would not buy again
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2025
reviews.review: The smell!! I use as bathroom wipes, no bad reaction but they bad not like the name brands water wipes, I won’t buy again. They are pretty thin too.

reviews.name: Amanda Pederson
reviews.title: Definitely are cheap
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2024
reviews.review: Every time I struggle to use these, I say I’m going to leave a review, now I finally am! I got these as a clean option that was cheaper than the ones we were using and they definitely are cheap. The packaging seems like every other pack of wipes, but it tears! Whenever you’re trying to get a wipe out they come out a million at once and then the packaging tears and the closure sticker barely holds. I’m used to wipes sticking together, but somehow, these stick WORSE. When you’re trying to pull them apart they just stretch out and stay stuck. So many times I’ve gotten just a stack of wipes at once, especially after the packaging is torn. I’ve resorted to taking a bunch out, separating, refolding, and putting them back in the pack. They are also so thin, almost threadbare, usually with other wipes, I feel like my hand is “protected,” but with these I feel like my hand is much more “exposed.” They also don’t smell very good. Will be switching back to a different brand once I suffer through the rest of these.

reviews.name: ValerReas.

I hate these. They’re a great idea for cleaner wipes but they need to be thicker add more moisture and maybe some sort of oils for baby skin.

Because of this, it took two to three times the amount of wipes to clean what my regulars would do. I would not recommend.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2024
reviews.review: These wipes are probably not worth your time. I used these wipes for months because they were one of the “cleaner” wipe options. Then started using several different others and landed on Kudos wipes. I had to buy a pack of Pura wipes again because Kudos has been out of stock at Target. Well, never again will I get these wipes! They are a lot worse than I remember. They are so thin, I end up having to use triple the amount of wipes and they barely have any moisture, so it is hard to get my toddler’s bottom fully clean. Even my toddler hates them!! He has been crying during diaper changes because the wipes are so dry. I hope Pura improves these wipes! I love Pura diapers, so it’s definitely disappointing. Will be going with Joonya wipes until Kudos is back in stock!

reviews.title: Worst Wipes I’ve Used
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2024
reviews.review: I wanted to love these due to the natural ingredients, but these wipes are all around TERRIBLE. The packaging is frustrating. I either get a bunch of wipes all at once or I end up ripping a single wipe on the way out. The resealable cover loses its stickiness and stops sealing the wipes well after a few uses. It takes me 6-7 of these wipes to clean up a mess that 2 Millie Moon wipes could take care of. And these are far rougher on my baby than other wipes. Anytime I use them we start to notice some redness/diaper rash on her bottom. I will not be purchasing these again and would not recommend them to other parents.

reviews.name: Trace
reviews.title: Too thin and dry
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2025
reviews.review: These wipes are as thin as tissue paper and barely wet. You have to use two at a time just for a wet diaper. I will not purchase these ever again.

reviews.name: Brighid
reviews.title: Not One-handed
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2025
reviews.review:
Tried 2 packs, very disappointed. Definitely need 2 hands and often still get a clump. The closure seal is sticky for only half-way through pack, then many wipes wasted because dried-out. Too frustrating!
I like the company’s mission.

reviews.name: Cory
reviews.title: Not great
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2024
reviews.review: These wipes smell bad, and they are so thin. I like the price, but you’re using twice as many wipes when you could spend a little more on better wipes that are thicker and use fewer. Do not recommend. And now I’m stuck with hundreds of stinky crappy wipes.🤦‍♀️

reviews.name: JC
reviews.title: Hard to get one at a time.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2024
reviews.review:
The seal doesn’t really seal, so it’ll dry up your wipes. It’s hard to get one at a time, if you get multiples it’s impossible to put it back neatly.

Would not recommend, actual product is good. But the packaging, seal, and way it’s designed are terrible.

reviews.name: Alexandria
reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THESE!!!!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2024
reviews.review:
I REPEAT DO NOT BUY THESE.
I have tried a few different brands of wipes for my baby over the past few months. I was told these were great and I liked the fact they were biodegradable and supposedly no fragrance, alcohol, chlorine ect. So I decided to order. First time I used them I thought i noticed a weird smell but I was in a hurry so I didn't really pay attention. Next diaper change I examined them and smelled them and they have the WORST strong, chemical smell !!!! And on top of it, my baby was already developing redness !!!!! I can't believe it ! She's never even gotten a rash from occasional use of regular pampers. 🙄 these are terrible and obviously contaminated!!! If I could give -stars I would.

reviews.name: Adriana
reviews.title: Very dry
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2024
reviews.review: I love this brand of diapers so I thought I’d give their wipes a try and sadly I was very disappointed. The wipes are very dry and thin. The packaging is also very cheap. Would not buy again nor would I recommend.

reviews.name: Shannae
reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2025
reviews.review: After seeing others recommend these wipes I tried them out and they caused terrible diaper rash on my baby. Immediately returned them. Will not use again.

reviews.name: steph
reviews.title: Green baby wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2024
reviews.review:
Wow. These are the thinnest wipes I’ve ever come across. The packaging isn’t good either, because you can not extricate them from the package easily without great difficulty. Apparently, the Ingredients in the wipes are “pure” , and that’s a good start, however, the entire product is generally flawed due to the sheer thinness of the wipe itself , so it defeats the purpose that they are “ green”.
I won’t be purchasing these again The company needs to revamp their product first.

reviews.name: A. B.
reviews.title: WORST WIPE EVER, no exaggeration
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2024
reviews.review:
This was the worst baby wipe or face wipe I've ever tried and I've tried DOZENS over the years

... There was something WRONG with these wipes!!! They smelled RANCID, SPOILED -- and totally messed up

They were also THE THINNEST WIPE I HAVE EVER USED

y'all... I wiped.... "Something" with a wipe
And my HAND SMELLED LIKE "SOMETHING" afterwards

Oh holy lord.

I kept on trying to pretend these wipes didn't smell like heck on Earth, I even rinsed them out at some points when I was desperate and without any kind of toilet paper, but dude, they made me ANXIOUS.

Any unscented baby wipe ever would be better than the wipes I got, omg. Save yourself.

reviews.name: Faith
reviews.title: Would not buy again
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2024
reviews.review: Bought them because they are non-toxic but the way they are packaged make them awful to use. You can never pull just one wipe at a time because they are all stuck together. And the sticker opining doesn’t restick very well leading to dry wipes. I’ll spend the extra couple dollars on another non-toxic brand.

reviews.name: Breanna
reviews.title: Awful.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2024
reviews.review: Packages came slashed and/or opened. One of the fully opened ones you could see the wipes were discolored (brown). I had pictures on a different review, but it didn’t get approved for whatever reason. We decided to go with a different brand after reading more reviews.

reviews.name: Robin
reviews.title: Waste of money
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2024
reviews.review: These wipes are the worse ever! Can’t pull one or two out at a time because they all come out. They are extremely weak and thin.

reviews.name: Samantha S
reviews.title: Absolutely useless
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2024
reviews.review: I wish I could give these a negative rating. The sheets are tiny, super thin, don't pull out easily, and rip easily. I have to pull out 2-3 just for a typical diaper and a huge pile for a poopy diaper. I love that they are ewg certified, but they are so difficult to use that i'd rather find something else. My husband refused to use them because they are so hard to pull out of the packaging then wipe so poorly.

reviews.name: Suzanne Cavalcante
reviews.title: Horrible don't buy these...I didn't even want to give this product one star...
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2024
reviews.review: I do not even want to give a one star rating.....This product is horrible in every way...The packaging gives you a one inch opening to be able to access the wipes..the wipes come out all at once not one not two sometimes you have five or six of this dry skimpy wipes in your hand..This has to be the worse baby wipes on the market...go past them..there are many better ones on this planet to buy.

reviews.name: Land of Lakes
reviews.title: Not good
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2024
reviews.review: I have been trying a lot of non toxic wipes and these are by far my least favorite. They are very small, thin and dry. The hole in the package is very small and hard to get the wipes out. I would not recommend or buy again.

reviews.name: Erin Clippard
reviews.title: Hated these
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2024
reviews.review: They were so thin you could see through them and barely moist at all. I would have been better off using one-ply toilet paper to wipe my baby. Also the wipes container doesn’t reseal well.

reviews.name: Brianna
reviews.title: Will not buy again.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2024
reviews.review: On baby #3 here. I really like that these wipes are clean as far as ingredients, but they are very very thin, not very moist, and small. I need at least 4 to clean up a newborn poop vs 1 or 2 of the honest wipes. I also really do not like the packaging, the plastic flap sticker closure does not ensure a seal, and you cant pull out a wipe one handed, they all are stuck together and just keep coming out together. I will not purchase again.

reviews.name: Amazon Customer
reviews.title: Foul smell
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2024
reviews.review: These are the worst wet wipes I have tried so far. They smell sour, like spoiled milk. I didn’t realize clean water wipes can smell this bad. Now I’m wondering what else is in them? For days I was wondering why my little one smelled so bad. I showered her, wiped more (which was a mistake) until I smelled the wipes. Also, they don’t separate when pulled out and they’re extremely thin. Waste of money. I won’t be purchasing again.

reviews.name: Tiffany Hernandez
reviews.title: Terrible rash
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2024
reviews.review: Gave my baby who’s never been sensitive to anything a terrible rash compete with bumps, bleeding, sensitivity, etc. It took me 2 days to realize it was the wipes and the rash was getting worse the whole time. I realized in the middle of the night and I stopped using them, in 24 hours all gone.

reviews.name: Susan Ridgeway Arnett
reviews.title: Not happy with product.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2025
reviews.review: I hate to complain, but this product is terrible.

reviews.name: Paula A.
reviews.title: It works I guess
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2024
reviews.review: Yes it works to wipe but it just has a weird factory smell so I would say just stick with baby wipes unless you really need something flushable- but even then I wouldn't recommend this brand. My family didn't have any irritation with the wipe so 🤷‍♀️.

reviews.name: Heather Garrett
reviews.title: Horrible smelling
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2024

reviews.title: Same size,same count- $10 more than baby wipes!!!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2024
reviews.review:
I was
Shocked. I expected a larger wipe paying $10 more for
for package. No— exact same
size —also flushing any wipe into sewer is bad and really bad if you are on septic.
I feel ripped off and deceived.
But the wipe is a good product. Doesn't dry my fingers out way others do.

reviews.review: These are only $3 because the packaging is so bad it's nearly impossible to re-close once you've opened it. Consequently, it dries out before you can even finish the pack. Be prepared to find something else to store them in properly. Personally, I'm just gonna pay a bit more for a brand with better packaging next time.

reviews.name: Robert J.
reviews.title: Disappointing wipes
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2024
reviews.review: I really love Pura diapers for my baby so I was excited to try the wipes. What a disappointment! They're incredibly thin and you need to use 2 to replace 1 regular wipe (such as Huggies). I really appreciate the clean ingredients but for the price these just aren't cutting it. Cannot recommend.

reviews.name: Ariana
reviews.title: Worst wipes ever
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2024
reviews.review: I thought I hated the pampers wipes.. these are even worse. The almost have a dry texture to them. And they stick together so you can’t get them out easily. They also make an awful sound/feeling when separating like nails on a chalkboard. Price is right and I like that they are no chemicals but I’m never buying them again

reviews.name: H.K

reviews.review: We have 3 kids under the age of 2. Gave them all terrible diaper rash- especially the baby. Just awful! Packaging is bad too- seals back with a sticker and you can never pull one or two wipes at a time!!

I also don’t like that there’s no lid to close to keep the wipes from drying out, also they are hard to pull out and the little plastic seal only works for so long. I give the diapers and wipes, two thumbs down!

reviews.name: Brandi Dunn
